curam.util.persistence.validation.customizable.validator
Interface StringValidator

public interface StringValidator

Validation methods for String objects.

The methods verify that the validation with supplied ValidationContext is enabled before performing the check.

If the validation is enabled, the methods perform the check. If the check is successful, the methods return true. If the check is unsuccessful, the methods flag to the error handling infrastructure that the validation has been unsuccessful, and then return false.

If the validation is disabled, the methods all return true.

Method Summary

Method Detail

contains

boolean contains(ValidationContext ctx,
                 AppException appException,
                 java.lang.String str,
                 java.lang.String substring)
Validates that the supplied string contains the supplied substring.

Note that passing a null value to any of the String parameters causes validation to fail.

Parameters:
ctx - The validation context for the validation.
appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
str - The string to validate.
substring - The substring that the string should contain.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful OR disabled, false if it is unsuccessful.

notBlank

boolean notBlank(ValidationContext ctx,
                 AppException appException,
                 java.lang.String str)
Validates that the supplied string is not blank. That is, not null and not consisting entirely of whitespace.

Note that passing null to the String parameter causes validation to fail.

Parameters:
ctx - The validation context for the validation.
appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
str - The string to validate.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful OR disabled, false if it is unsuccessful.

notEmpty

boolean notEmpty(ValidationContext ctx,
                 AppException appException,
                 java.lang.String str)
Validates that the supplied string is not empty. That is, not null and not equal to the empty string ("").

Note that passing null to the String parameter causes validation to fail.

Parameters:
ctx - The validation context for the validation.
appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
str - The string to validate.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful OR disabled, false if it is unsuccessful.

notEquals

boolean notEquals(ValidationContext ctx,
                  AppException appException,
                  java.lang.String actual,
                  java.lang.String other)
Validates that the supplied actual string is not equal to the other supplied string.

Parameters:
ctx - The validation context for the validation.
appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
actual - The actual string.
other - The other string - that is, the string to which it is not expected that the supplied string will be equal.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful OR disabled, false if it is unsuccessful.

notEqualsIgnoreCase

boolean notEqualsIgnoreCase(ValidationContext ctx,
                            AppException appException,
                            java.lang.String actual,
                            java.lang.String other)
Validates that the supplied actual string is not equal to the supplied other string, ignoring differences in case.

Parameters:
ctx - The validation context for the validation.
appException - The exception to use to indicate that the validation has failed.
actual - The actual string.
other - The other string - that is, the string to which it is not expected that the supplied string will be equal (ignoring differences in case).
Returns:
True if the validation is successful OR disabled, false if it is unsuccessful.

                   AppException appException,
                   java.lang.String str,

str - The string to validate.
prefix - The prefix with which the supplied string should start.
Returns:
True if the validation is successful OR disabled, false if it is unsuccessful.
